title: XII century typography
content:
I'm on the process os starting a new multimedia CD-ROM for a XII century subject. It will be about the Templarios(Knights Templar) presence in Portugal on the XII century.   
   
Does anyone Know any good references on articles & the typography used on those days? Is there any font inspired on that century/subject?   
   
Check this info source:   
http://www.templarhistory.com/   
   
Thanks in advance ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051922im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)  
adriano   
   
{please move this topic to the Design forum... ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051922im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)}
author: adriano

comments.content: See this [Harvard article](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051922/http:/courses.dce.harvard.edu/~humae105/fall97/twest/time.htm) for some information on Medieval Scripts. Since you are pre-dating printing with type, I think this is the sort of writing you will need to re-create. The [Scriptorium](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051922/http:/www.ragnarokpress.com/scriptorium/) is a place whre you may find fonts based on early scripts.
